website_summaries.verdict: Outstanding price point for six official size hard cricket tennis balls.
pros: Suitable for both recreational-level practice and games
Carries a standard weight and size for a tennis ball cricket ball
These hard balls will give you a long lifespan
Using tennis balls means players can wear less protective gear
cons: May still need to be taped to reduce bouncing

customer_reviews.title: Weight of balls are different
customer_reviews.text: Weight of balls are different . Balls are getting ripped after 10-15 overs most balls are 126 gm and few are 158 gms By reducing weight just imagine how much money manufacturer is earning Whereas Nivia claim it 145Grams +/ - 5 Grams(Pack Of 6 Balls). Its total waste of money for our tournament
customer_reviews.author: Mano

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my non-traditional use
customer_reviews.text: I have a pure white down parka. To dry it, manufacturer suggests placing in a dryer with tennis balls so it remains puffy. Do you know how difficult it is to find white tennis balls (very difficult). These worked beautifully, particularly because they are heavier than tennis balls. They do have black writing on them, and I didn’t want that to transfer to my coat, so I placed each one in a white sock to insure the writing wouldn’t bleed. Not a traditional use, for sure, but they were perfect for me!!
customer_reviews.author: Jean L. Nightingale

customer_reviews.title: Plantar Fasciitis Relief
customer_reviews.text: This ball seems to be solid rubber, or at least is very dense. Perfect for self administering some pressure on the bottom of my feet to relieve Plantar Fasciitis. Perhaps not its original intended use, but works better than a normal tennis ball for me. I use these in conjuction with a nubbed foot roller. Great item to throw in the backpack to work out the aches after a good hike. Takes up nearly no space.
customer_reviews.author: Big Redd

customer_reviews.title: Very good substitute for a cricket ball, for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. I used it to play cricket with my grandson during his Christmas holidays. We played for an hour each day, for 10 days. The ball is heavier than a tennis ball and is very enjoyable to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Srikanth

customer_reviews.title: Lasts longer and good build quality
customer_reviews.text: There is no actual complaint. I wanted a hard ball to play cricket that is exactly what I got. The build quality is better the Penn branded tennis balls that I bought earlier which didn't last the same duration as these did in the same place. It is made of rubber and then coated with nylon or some kind of will. I wish it was made of something else rather than rubber because it gives the ball extra bounce that you didn't expect it to, when it's pitched.
customer_reviews.author: Nadun Pullaperuma

customer_reviews.title: The bounce of the balls is too good and the fur seems to be quick dry when ...
customer_reviews.text: Received the item late but nothing wrong with the product. The bounce of the balls is too good and the fur seems to be quick dry when the ball gets wet. Happy to play cricket with these balls
customer_reviews.author: Chintan Virani

customer_reviews.title: ball last longer
customer_reviews.text: We play every weekend with this brand tennis balls. Every weekend we use the ball for nearly 20 overs. This is the first tennis ball bought in US from Amazon that last even when the red skin comes offs. The ball shape is good, swings nice & it the pitch is hard would give predicted bounce. If you get your timings right and want to hit the ball off the park this ball is what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: They become brown after use.
customer_reviews.text: These are heavy weighted tennis balls best used for cricket. We played on a wet baseball pitch and the got a bit dark and it was difficult to spot after a while. Dew also made the ball heavier than usual. But that’s common for all weighted tennis balls.
customer_reviews.author: drummerboy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product. For playing cricket gets the job done. I would rate it 4 because the ball looses it's outer surface very fast. It's like pretty good for 10-20 overs max then it reminds me of the rubber ball I used to play when I was kid and it's so hard see as it turns to absolute grey other than that it's good.
customer_reviews.author: Kingtheja

customer_reviews.title: Very light and weight
customer_reviews.text: Lights weight and good bounce on the ball so I recommend u guys that is the best ball ever so buy it and try it once
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed Nahib uddin

customer_reviews.title: Gives a good feel for Cricket
customer_reviews.text: The county league uses this brand for our tennis ball cricket league. They hold up really well and have a good speed and weight to them.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Balls Quality
customer_reviews.text: The recent purchase balls did not last long. They are torn soon after we started playing. It never happened before, maybe the recent batches are bit defective. I am a regular buyer of this product, will see if the future purchases turns out to be the same or good.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Good ball to play practice match
customer_reviews.text: The balls are really hard, you can really tell it bounces a lot when you are going to bowl. Good selection of balls to practice in the nets.
customer_reviews.author: Gazi Sajjad Hossain

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: If your dog is a serious chewer and mows through tennis balls (like mine) - get a few of these. They are much more thick and durable, and have a great bounce to them. Granted I purchased them not for what they were intended, but my dog loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Sporegonzola

customer_reviews.title: Great got dogs tuff on tennis balls
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves them she cant tare them up like a normal tennis ball
customer_reviews.author: Kx311

customer_reviews.title: Bonus a lot
customer_reviews.text: Nice ball to play in green fields , but it’s too hard and bouncing too much
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect heavy tennis ball for cricket. I made a few tape balls too.
customer_reviews.author: Manish

customer_reviews.title: Not worthy for the price
customer_reviews.text: The red feathers disappears quickly and the ball has too much bounce. The balls do not last more 3to4 days, it’s been a week purchased so far, two balls got broken already. This is the reason for me to give 1 star rating
customer_reviews.author: Sap

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your time - Balls are Duplicate
customer_reviews.text: Dont waste your time buying these balls , They are not original . Hard tennis balls are suppose to be around 5 Ounces but these are 4.4 ounces . very light weight .
customer_reviews.author: harikrishna

customer_reviews.title: Great practice balls
customer_reviews.text: I only play cricket among friends and we don't want to buy the padding needed when using a real cricket ball. These practice balls are great for friendly games as they are not as hard as real leather cricket balls, but not as soft/light as tennis balls. We played twice for several hours at a time with a six pack and none show signs of breakage yet.
customer_reviews.author: Bastian

customer_reviews.title: Expecting to last more.
customer_reviews.text: able to last long for 20 overs. As we played during the winter it became old sooner and not able to use further.
customer_reviews.author: vijayasingh

customer_reviews.title: Too bouncy
customer_reviews.text: The ball is heavy as expected, but it is NOT appropriate for cricket. It bounces just too much. Spin bowling makes it bounce as much as 6-7ft which is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Deepankar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for recreational cricket.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tennis ball for recreational cricket. It's not too light nor is it too hard. I would recommend the red color over the yellow as it provides better visibility.
customer_reviews.author: Aravind

customer_reviews.title: Size is too small for adults. Cracked after 2 games. Won't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Size is too small for adults. Fist ball cracked after 2, 10 over games. Bounce is good. Very Hard and Heavy
customer_reviews.author: Chanchal/Urmila

customer_reviews.title: Bit too bouncy
customer_reviews.text: These balls are decent for playing cricket, but they bounce far too much than is expected. An essential aspect of cricket is the ability to judge the bounce of the ball, but these make it very challenging, even for expert batsmen.
customer_reviews.author: HN1519

customer_reviews.title: Good set but a bit bouncy on hard surface
customer_reviews.text: Balls are of very good quality but a bit too bouncy on hard surfaces. It may be good for actual pitches or grass but not ideal for playing with kids on hard surface.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin Garg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the dryer with comforters
customer_reviews.text: Great weight for using in the dryer for drying comforters. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Grammie B

customer_reviews.title: good for outdoor play
customer_reviews.text: it's very good to play but when it's old. it's getting rock hard.
customer_reviews.author: Mohan Kumar Raju Borukati

customer_reviews.title: Horrible light tennis balls quality
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely disappointed... I got set of 6 white and 6 green. White were great but green were light as a normal tennis. I Ilan going to tell all my team to stop buying from u guys unless u send me New Heaby ones. Really disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good balls for amateur cricket
customer_reviews.text: The balls are a good weight for spin and pace bowling. Has good bounce as well. The fur on top lasts may be between 6 and 10 overs, not a lot more than that. the ball outlasts the fur probably 50 - 65 overs which is good enough for weekend cricket in tennis courts. A couple of packs will do for the spring and summer season.
customer_reviews.author: Raghunandan Mukundan

customer_reviews.title: Decent for cricket
customer_reviews.text: Decent balls for playing but the fir starts losing really fast. On a single day w we had to replace 3 balls because of this.
customer_reviews.author: RAHUL SUHAG

customer_reviews.title: Good for concrete not for grass
customer_reviews.text: Good bounce, very sturdy, lasts well through a couple of games on concrete
customer_reviews.author: Parth

customer_reviews.title: Light weight ball Instead of Heavy weight
customer_reviews.text: The quality of ball is poor and I see lightly weighed ball came when I order heavy weight cricket ball Please update this issue
customer_reviews.author: Naveen Sri

customer_reviews.title: Expected as I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: These ball a of very good quality. We are enjoying playing cricket with it for getting my kid cricket practice in our garage.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: It comes pack of 6. I used it to practice tennis stroke against the wall (not cricket). Forces you to hit this ball fair and square against your racquet due to it's heavy mass. It's just that the fussy fiber disappears quickly after heavy hitting for a couple of hours. Good thing I still have balls left.
customer_reviews.author: Dino F.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Heavy Cricket Balls!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice Cricket Balls. Hese are heavy as expected, jumps really nice on grass.
customer_reviews.author: Vikas Seth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tennis ball cricket
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for tennis ball cricket. Not as bouncy as the red version of the same tennis balls. Fairly good quality and long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: RV

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hard tennis balls!
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned these are hard tennis balls for cricket. We use these regularly. One set is good for 3-4 months of weekend games. Hope this is helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Magic Mint

customer_reviews.title: Very good for cricket
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing for people who wants to play cricket with hard tennis balls.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed K.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We have a German shepherd great for play time ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Connie Pauzus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Hard tennis cricket ball
customer_reviews.text: I had little concerns about the bounce it produces , everything got cleared after playing a game with this. Perfect tennis ball I would say.
customer_reviews.author: Ajay Shikhare

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad product
customer_reviews.text: Product was as described - the balls are quite heavy so a good mid way point between a cricket ball and a tennis ball.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M.

customer_reviews.title: But will get full value for a good timing shot
customer_reviews.text: Used it to play cricket. Very bouncy and heavy. Need to be careful otherwise might get hurt. But will get full value for a good timing shot.
customer_reviews.author: MD MAHBUBUR RAHMAN

customer_reviews.title: Hard to grip
customer_reviews.text: Too much fur, and hard to grip. Weight was good.
customer_reviews.author: Nandakiran Kirubanandan

customer_reviews.title: Great cricket ball
customer_reviews.text: It was a great cricket ball. I am using this ball for 4 weeks and played lots of game. There is no wear and tear on the ball. It is a great ball.
customer_reviews.author: Prabesh Subedi

customer_reviews.title: Received the box with 6 pcs less.
customer_reviews.text: For some reason 6 of them were lost. In the box there were 12 but I got 6 only.
customer_reviews.author: abdwar

customer_reviews.title: Sustainable hard tennis ball!
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Lasts super long. Although it looks like a cube on the advertisement, it gradually becomes perfectly spherical upon the use! Highly recommended for hard tennis ball cricket! Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: anushka

customer_reviews.title: Not good for cricket
customer_reviews.text: They are very heavy tennis balls, high chances of getting hurt by these balls.
customer_reviews.author: Arslan Fida

customer_reviews.title: Not Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Its not Heavy tennis ball. It s medium weight but bounce good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for few games
customer_reviews.text: Ok, the cloth on the balls coming off after few games which is not good
customer_reviews.author: Kartheek Metta

customer_reviews.title: Best for Cricket.
customer_reviews.text: Harder than the normal tennis. This is lighter than SG tennis balls
customer_reviews.author: Cabhs

customer_reviews.title: Good & Durable
customer_reviews.text: We use these balls for cricket practice; they are good and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy..!
customer_reviews.text: Ideal for playing cricket. Yellow ones are a bit heavier than the red ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: Great product 👍 and fast shipping just in 4 days in received to NL.
customer_reviews.author: Uvaraj

customer_reviews.title: Not the heavy version
customer_reviews.text: Not the heavy ball that we use to play cricket .
customer_reviews.author: Vikraant R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Order arrived on time and product was as expected. Used it a lot to play cricket.
customer_reviews.author: Hari

customer_reviews.title: Not good for tape tennis on concrete
customer_reviews.text: Bounced too much. Not good for tape tennis on concrete
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Stinky!
customer_reviews.text: These will be perfect for my 8 year old son but I do hope the awful smell goes away!
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Shopper

customer_reviews.title: very light
customer_reviews.text: very lighter than expected. I was expecting a heavier ball
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First 2 balls out of the 6 pack lasted a ...
customer_reviews.text: First 2 balls out of the 6 pack lasted a while , but the 3rd and 4th balls barely lasted 2 days. Very disappointing . Onto the 5th and 6th ball
customer_reviews.author: Gunnar

customer_reviews.title: Balls received seems different from what is in pictures
customer_reviews.text: Not the same ball I ordered before. Light in weight and packaging is not same as shown. We don't like playing woth these.
customer_reviews.author: Satish Jha

customer_reviews.title: good job
customer_reviews.text: good costumer service i like deliveru should keep bat cricket kit that included everything also the hard ball thanks again
customer_reviews.author: guju98

customer_reviews.title: Good enough alternative for practice
customer_reviews.text: Very timely and well packaged delivery by the seller. The ball fits the purpose (for practice only). We play on the street and it is a little too bouncy and the skin starts to come off after 3-4 weeks of regular use (2-3 times a week).
customer_reviews.author: Rahman Family

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The middle part is little raised which makes the ball bounce unevenly at times!
customer_reviews.author: Sunil

customer_reviews.title: Good, but it needs some more Quality to be ...
customer_reviews.text: Good , but it needs some more Quality to be added if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for practice sessions at my work. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for practice sessions at my work. The ball seem to be lighter than the ones we used to play. Some of them gets out of shape after the 1st day usage. And it bounces too much as well.
customer_reviews.author: Geen

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: These balls are as heavy as a heavy tennis ball should be
customer_reviews.author: HariKrishna Mandali

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend it to you all
customer_reviews.text: Yup, got what I expected. I would recommend it to you all.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mannat

customer_reviews.title: Good cricket balls
customer_reviews.text: Good cricket balls. Appears to have been imported from India. Only concern was the time it took to get delivered - wish it was quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Nagesh Subramanian

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are the heavy ones.. I prefer the lighter ones.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Lyon

customer_reviews.title: Leight Weight Balls
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight compared to actual Nivia heavy tennis balls. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Seshu

customer_reviews.title: These Heavy Tennis Balls are pretty good and are good for playing a casual match ...
customer_reviews.text: These Heavy Tennis Balls are pretty good and are good for playing a casual match with friends, they last a long time and give you lots of bounce.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The Cricket ball is good quality but slightly smaller in size for adult cricket.
customer_reviews.author: Atul Bokane

customer_reviews.title: Balls!... The Nivia Story.
customer_reviews.text: Many reveiws claimed they cracked, but in fact they are pretty solid. These are just like the one's I used to play with in india, so they are quite nostalgic. Overall good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Claire

customer_reviews.title: not good for playing
customer_reviews.text: The ball had irregular shapes at the center of the two halves joined , not good for playing
customer_reviews.author: saravanakumar velayutham

customer_reviews.title: great ball for outdoor cricket practice
customer_reviews.text: great heavy cricket ball . we use it a lot during our cricket games and the ball holds its shape and color quite well . Excellent bounce , grip and weight makes it the ideal cricket ball for outdoor use . we play in a baseball field and this ball goes a long way to ensure a happy and satisfying game. beware its a bit easy so some protection is needed to ensure you dont get hurt
customer_reviews.author: Denver_TechJunkie

customer_reviews.title: fast delivery..perfect...recommend 100%
customer_reviews.text: The delivery was so fast ...I got delivery in 3 days after i placed order.the ball was great heavy tennis too.
customer_reviews.author: Pavan Patel

customer_reviews.title: Good bounce, thin felt layer
customer_reviews.text: These balls have good amount of bounce, perfect for recreational cricket. The felt gets thinner over time and it is a good thing for grassy pitches. Some of the balls did not last long; popped after playing ~100 overs. (might depend on how hard you hit). Overall, good price for hard tennis balls.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, coz it is light weight compared to actual nivia heavy cricket balls..
customer_reviews.author: Silpa

customer_reviews.title: As good as I need
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and weight..An example of a good tennis cricket ball. It bounces well and swings as well, love it
customer_reviews.author: basu

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So good and bounce also good enough to play cricket
customer_reviews.author: Ravi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These balls work great with the bat that I also purchased from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Anil

customer_reviews.title: I doubt its an original nivia product!
customer_reviews.text: The pack had six balls and out of six, 2 were defective pieces. The balls fell apart into two halves with just one hit. I doubt its an original nivia product!
customer_reviews.author: Ankur

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: it is very small. smaller than tennis ball. hard to play cricket with it.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Worst balls that I have never seen. All of them broke in 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Vijayendar Reddy Kisanagaram

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: It's not a good quality and good for playing and also looks like normal tennis ball, please don't buy this product
customer_reviews.author: somasundaram karuppa gounder

customer_reviews.title: These are very sturdy, but when they arrived
customer_reviews.text: These are very sturdy, but when they arrived, parts were missing. The directions were also so blurred that I could not read what they said. Other than that, they are nice looking and seem like they will last
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got the items on time and un goof packaging
customer_reviews.text: They are great. I wanted heavy tennis ball for cricket and I got it within days... I like them
customer_reviews.author: sshah75

product_meta.title: Nivia Heavy Tennis Ball Cricket Ball (Pack of 6)
product_meta.description: Genuine Nivia Hard Cricket Tennis balls Perfectly round shaped with standard weight. Made in official yellow, red and also assorted colors. Approved by Tennis Ball Cricket Federation of India.
feature_bullets: Hard Tennis Ball; Made for Cricket Play
